{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3584803,"name":"Teddy","username":"dragonblade316","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dragonblade316/{size}/211424_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-09T03:12:17.849Z","cooked":"

Recently, while looking in the Questnav Thread, I saw a post by @viggy96 suggesting the use of an Oak d camera with the spectacular ai tracking suite as a potential alternative to Questnav.

This is a topic I have been curious about for a while so I decided to take my Oak D lite and test the concept.

After a couple days and a new USB cable, I have managed to get spectacular ai tracking location using the oak d lite. So far it works but not well, I see occasional jumps and sometimes it drifts away. It also seems to struggle with rotation and things going in front of it.

I’m guessing these issues are config problems on my part. Some of these issues may be due to the fact that the oak d lite is not officially supported.

Right now the next step in this project is making a better visualizer since the ones from spectacular ai are either bad or not working for me.

Let me know if any of you have any tips or questions.

I’d like to see this with another model that has a dot projector as well. I plan on getting one in the near future. That combined with a wider FOV for the tracking cameras should help.

I’m hopeful that this might provide a solution that is more compact, and easier to setup, and has less moving parts (setup wise) than QuestNav.

I have a OAK-D Pro W on the way.

Slight update:
Found a nice UI library that I should be able to set up fairly quickly so hopefully I will be able to post an initial prototype visualizer tomorrow.

Progress has been made, the testing ui is now semi functional.
Its really janky since I wrote it in a morning under a time crunch but it mostly works.

Source code is here

The end of the gif seems to confirm my suspisions that rotation messes up the position. I don’t know why yet but I have a couple guesses.

more updates probably coming soon.

Also @viggy96, it was not designed for a specific oak model so your Oak D pro should work.

Do you know if the necessary Python packages for this can be installed on the roboRIO?

Was thinking that in actual deployment, it would be nice if the “host” computer was the roboRIO itself.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":37,"updated_at":"2025-04-10T19:52:06.558Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":347,"readers_count":346,"score":74.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":498538,"topic_slug":"exploring-the-use-of-an-oak-d-lite-and-spectacular-ai-for-localization","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":62239,"username":"dragonblade316","name":"Teddy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dragonblade316/{size}/211424_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"post_url":"/t/exploring-the-use-of-an-oak-d-lite-and-spectacular-ai-for-localization/498538/7","custom_user_title":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3587328,"name":"Teddy","username":"dragonblade316","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dragonblade316/{size}/211424_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-10T20:54:45.981Z","cooked":"

I put a list of python dependencies on the GitHub readme.

Frankly I think it would be rather unwise to try and install a package like this on the roborio. April tag competition is already expensive enough and while I have not benchmarked my tool I doubt it is computationally cheap.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":37,"updated_at":"2025-04-10T20:56:18.290Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":324,"readers_count":323,"score":69.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":498538,"topic_slug":"exploring-the-use-of-an-oak-d-lite-and-spectacular-ai-for-localization","display_username":"Teddy","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":24613,"username":"viggy96","name":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62239,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"That one guy obsessed with programming"},"post_url":"/t/exploring-the-use-of-an-oak-d-lite-and-spectacular-ai-for-localization/498538/8","custom_user_title":"That one guy obsessed with programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3587428,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-10T22:27:13.397Z","cooked":"

Is it not offloaded to the OAK-D?

Maybe it’s not offloaded on the Lite.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":37,"updated_at":"2025-04-10T22:27:13.397Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":312,"readers_count":311,"score":82.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":498538,"topic_slug":"exploring-the-use-of-an-oak-d-lite-and-spectacular-ai-for-localization","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":62239,"username":"dragonblade316","name":"Teddy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dragonblade316/{size}/211424_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"post_url":"/t/exploring-the-use-of-an-oak-d-lite-and-spectacular-ai-for-localization/498538/9","custom_user_title":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3587473,"name":"rahilm","username":"rahilm","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/d9b06d/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-10T23:09:49.480Z","cooked":"

I’ve been looking into the OAK-D as well to experiment with, but it seems like they don’t recommend running any VSLAM processing on board with the current gen of products: VIO and SLAM

The next gen OAK 4 coming out soon (but above the FRC price limit) do seem to have enough compute to do it onboard

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":37,"updated_at":"2025-04-10T23:09:49.480Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":299,"readers_count":298,"score":59.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":498538,"topic_slug":"exploring-the-use-of-an-oak-d-lite-and-spectacular-ai-for-localization","display_username":"rahilm","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.luxonis.com/software/ros/vio-slam/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"VIO and SLAM","clicks":13}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24613,"username":"viggy96","name":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12790,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/exploring-the-use-of-an-oak-d-lite-and-spectacular-ai-for-localization/498538/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3587478,"name":"Teddy","username":"dragonblade316","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dragonblade316/{size}/211424_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-10T23:15:09.465Z","cooked":"

As far as I know, spectacular ai does not offload to the oak (the lite will def not get special treatment since it’s not even supported officially).

As rahilm said, the producer of the oak themselves say that the current oakds are not powerful enough.

I wonder if dot projectors would be legal, or even viable if this ever catches on. I’m not sure how resistant this sort of system is to external interference, but with 2-3 robots in a match having these on, I would guess pose estimation would already become dodgy for all of them.

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":37,"updated_at":"2025-04-12T00:20:02.792Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":260,"readers_count":259,"score":102.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":498538,"topic_slug":"exploring-the-use-of-an-oak-d-lite-and-spectacular-ai-for-localization","display_username":"Pedro Braga","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/questnav-the-best-robot-pose-tracking-system-in-frc/476083/405","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"QuestNav: The Best Robot Pose Tracking System in FRC","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":24613,"username":"viggy96","name":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63359,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/exploring-the-use-of-an-oak-d-lite-and-spectacular-ai-for-localization/498538/14","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3589509,"name":"Teddy","username":"dragonblade316","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dragonblade316/{size}/211424_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-12T00:54:33.773Z","cooked":"

More progress made!

Most notably, I have fixed the rotation issue I was seeing with my oak d lite by setting the imu_to_camera matrix (the oak d lite is not supported so this was not preset. Shoutout to oseiskar for pointing me in the right direction).

I have also been working on setting up apriltag support. I’m currently running into an issue where it crashes when it detects a tag, and tries to initialize the tracking system. No idea why.

Currently, the stack trace points to it potentially being an issue with libc or something, but since it is all proprietary, I can’t know for sure.

Once I have apriltags working, I may rewrite my work so far to focus on nt4 support and easy maintainability. I will not need my own visualizer once I have advantagescope so it should not be too bad.

Anyway, if anyone has any idea what is causing the apriltag crashes, pls let me know.
